result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payments are to be maid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts Office in the amount of $50 a month beginning November 1, 2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superAgency.name: County
superAgency.notes: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of one year.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss count 2.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is to continue counseling and follow through with any other recommendations and to provide proof to the District Attorney's Office.
Defendant is not to have contact with E.R.N dob-10/07/2005.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry L. Firnstahl Jr.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

2:30 PM  Defendant Terry L. Firnstahl Jr. in court.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Terry L. Firnstahl Jr.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Attorney Tlusty recites the agreement into the record. Both parties recommend amending count 1 down to a county ordinance 26.10, pay the forfeiture of $263.50 plus the mandatory $67 victim witness surcharge. Both parties agree to a one year deferred entry of judgment in count 2 with the conditions that the defendant continues counseling and provides proof to the DA's Office. Defendant shall not have contact with E.N dob-10/7/2005. If defendant completes the one year deferred entry of judgment the state with move to dismiss count 2. Defendant enters a plea of no contest in count 1. Court makes a finding of guilt and orders defendant to pay the forfeiture of $263.50 plus the mandatory $67 victim witness surcharge. Defendant pleads no contest to count 2. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Statement made by Attorney Smith. Court accepts the one year deferred entry of judgment on count 2 with the  conditions that the defendant continues counseling and shows proof to the DA's Office, that the defendant does not have contact with E.N dob- 10/07/2005. Court orders that the costs be paid to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts office in the amount of $50 a month beginning November 1, 2022.-JN

3:03 PM Defendant Terry L. Firnstahl Jr. in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Terry L. Firnstahl Jr. Atty Smith requests to schedule a new Pretrial conference and status hearing Dates were agreed upon with both parties..-JN
Status hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Pretrial conference August 25, 2022 9:45 a.m.
Status hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.   Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall have no contact with E.R.N. - dob:  10-07-2005 and K.T.H. - dob:  7-13-2004.

01:22 PM Defendant Terry L. Firnstahl in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim notification has been complied.  Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered,  District attorney requests a signature bond in the amount of $2,000.0  booking.   Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with E.R.N. - dob:  10-7-2005 and K.T.H. - dob: 07-13-2004.  Court sets bond as requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Status hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm. - rt
